page.title: 13FLOODS IN FLEETWOOD
page.content: In 1926 Fleetwood council and a local estate agency spent Â£55,000 on building a sea wall to guard Fleetwood from the sea. The following year there was a flood, and the damage was estimated at Â£11,000. By 1928 the wall was complete and officially opened by Lord Derby in 1930. Years later in 1977 Fleetwood was again flooded and although the extent of the damage was worse than that of 1927, no_one was hurt. Many houses and schools were damaged particularly in the Larkholme area. It was reported in some of the local newspapers that people were actually drowning, but this was merely press exaggeration and the only sufferers were pets. The old sea wall was totally demolished in some areas and there now stands a much taller, supposedly stronger wall.
